means: 建立( constitute的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: On 6 July a People's Revolutionary Government was constituted.
sentence.Network_cn: 7月6日，人民革命政府正式成立。

sentence.Network_en: The accused will appear before a specially constituted military tribunal.
sentence.Network_cn: 被告将会面临特别军事法庭的审判。

sentence.Network_en: He is so constituted that he needs very little sleep.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的身体素质好,只需短时间睡眠.

原料山药500克，水发木耳25克，骨头汤650克，葱姜末、料酒、盐、味精、香油各适量。 制法1、将山药洗净，放入沸水中煮一下，去皮后切成滚刀块，入清水中漂洗干净。 2、取沙锅一只，放入山药块、水发木耳、料酒、葱姜末、骨头汤，用旺火烧沸，淋上香油，改用小火炖至山药块断生，加盐、味精再.

entry.def: If something constitutes a particular thing, it can be regarded as being that thing.

example.ex: Testing patients without their consent would constitute a professional and legal offence...
example.tran: 未经患者同意而对其进行检查被视为违反职业操守并触犯法律。

example.ex: The vote hardly constitutes a victory...
example.tran: 这次投票很难被视为一次胜利。

entry.def: If a number of things or people constitute something, they are the parts or members that form it.

example.ex: Volunteers constitute more than 95% of The Center's work force.
example.tran: 该中心95%以上的工作人员是志愿者。

example.ex: ...the four companies  constituting the Aramco partnership.
example.tran: 组成阿美合伙公司的4家公司

entry.tran: 设立，成立(委员会、政府等)
entry.def: When something such as a committee or government is constituted, it is formally established and given authority to operate.

example.ex: On 6 July a People's Revolutionary Government was constituted...
example.tran: 7月6日，人民革命政府正式成立。

example.ex: The accused will appear before a specially constituted military tribunal.
example.tran: 被告将会面临特别军事法庭的审判。

means.word_mean: 1. brought about or set up or accepted; especially long established;

sentences.sentence: "a team established as a member of a major league"
"enjoyed his prestige as an established writer"
